result.execSummary:
The defendant Lucas G. Stewart was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Firearm by Felon [Modifiers: Repeater], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2).
  • Intention. Imp.Animal Shelter-Sanitation [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 951.14(4).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
If probation revoked, Defendant eligible for Substance Abuse Program/Earned Early Release Program and Challenge Incarceration Program; must complete Substance Abuse/Earned Early Release Program first.

**9/3/2014 - JOC amended to reflect attorney fees in the amount of $2,975.25.  This amount includes cases 13CM621, 14CM120, 14CM174, 14CF141 & 14CF198.

miscConds.notes: Bond to be applied to court appointed attorney fees first, then to court costs and then to DNA surcharges.
Huber privileges granted for child care.
Defendant to obtain/maintain full time employment in an occupation acceptable to agent.

Defendant to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended.

No consumption or possession of any controlled substances without a valid prescription in defendant's own name and must take as prescribed.

No possession of drug paraphernalia.

Not be present where controlled substances are illegally sold or consumed.

No association with known drug dealers or drug users.

No consumption or possession of alcohol.  No entering taverns, bars or liquor stores for any purpose.

Comply with any assessments, treatment or conditions per agent.

Repay court appointed attorney fees in an amount to be determined; JOC to be amended after final billing submitted.

**9/3/2014 - JOC amended to reflect attorney fees in the amount of $2,975.25.  This amount includes cases 13CM621, 14CM120, 14CM174, 14CF141 & 14CF198.

Defendant to submit DNA sample.

Defendant to pay supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
